parameters.content:
# üöÄ Sam's Simplified RFP AI Agent

## How to Use:
1. **Step 1: Ingest Documents** - Click the 'Execute' button on the 'Trigger Entrypoint' node. This will pull files from your Google Drive folder.
2. **Step 2: Chat** - Use the Chat window to ask questions about your RFPs.

## Setting Up:
- **Google Drive**: Put your RFP documents (PDF or Google Docs) in a specific folder.
- **Credentials**: You only need to set up Google Drive and OpenAI credentials.
- **No Database**: This version uses 'In-Memory' storage, so it's super fast and requires zero setup!

parameters.initialMessages: Hi there Sam  !  This is your RFP creator

options.systemMessage:
You are Sam's RFP Assistant. Your job is to find exact answers from the documents Sam has uploaded.

1. Always search the documents first using the vector store tool.
2. Return the exact question and answer if you find a match.
3. Be concise and helpful.
4. Mention which document you found the answer in.

values.fieldLabel: Please Upload Your Question From Excel

Extract PDF Text.text:
Got it. Here‚Äôs a clean, realistic example RFP you can drop straight into Google Drive as a doc
or PDF and use to exercise your flow. This is intentionally boring-correct enterprise style ‚Äî
exactly the kind of thing automation + LLM workflows should chew through without drama.
Request for Proposal (RFP)
Automation & Workflow Orchestration Platform
RFP ID: RFP-2025-ACME-AUTO-001
Issue Date: December 20, 2025
Response Due: January 10, 2026
Issuing Organization: Acme Health Services, Inc.
1. Introduction
Acme Health Services, Inc. (‚ÄúAcme‚Äù) is seeking proposals from qualified vendors to provide an
Automation and Workflow Orchestration Platform to support internal business processes,
data operations, and system integrations.
The selected solution must be secure, scalable, auditable, and suitable for deployment in a
hybrid or self-hosted environment.
2. Organizational Background
Acme Health Services is a mid-sized healthcare services provider operating across multiple
U.S. states. Acme manages claims processing, provider onboarding, compliance reporting, and
internal IT operations that require reliable automation and orchestration capabilities.
3. Project Objectives
The primary objectives of this project are:

‚óè Reduce manual, repetitive operational work
‚óè Improve reliability and observability of automated workflows
‚óè Enable reusable, version-controlled automation
‚óè Support future AI-augmented workflows
‚óè Maintain compliance with healthcare security standards
4. Scope of Work
The vendor solution must support the following capabilities:
4.1 Automation Execution
‚óè Scripted and declarative automation support
‚óè Ability to execute Python-based workflows
‚óè Support for CLI-based or API-driven execution
4.2 Orchestration
‚óè Workflow scheduling and triggering
‚óè Dependency management between tasks
‚óè Support for event-driven workflows
4.3 Deployment Model
‚óè Self-hosted or on-prem deployment
‚óè Kubernetes-native or container-friendly architecture
‚óè No mandatory SaaS lock-in
4.4 Security & Compliance
‚óè Role-based access control (RBAC)
‚óè Audit logging
‚óè Secure secrets management
‚óè HIPAA-aligned security posture preferred
4.5 Observability
‚óè Execution logs per workflow run
‚óè Failure reporting and retry logic
‚óè Metrics and basic monitoring hooks

5. Technical Requirements
Vendors should address the following technical requirements:
‚óè Linux-compatible runtime
‚óè API-first architecture
‚óè Support for Git-based workflow definitions
‚óè Ability to run in air-gapped or restricted network environments
‚óè Minimal external dependencies
6. Vendor Qualifications
Proposals should include:
‚óè Company background and years in operation
‚óè Relevant customer references
‚óè Experience with automation platforms or workflow engines
‚óè Open-source involvement (if applicable)
7. Proposal Submission Requirements
Proposals must include:
1. Executive summary
2. Technical approach and architecture overview
3. Deployment model description
4. Security considerations
5. Pricing model
6. Implementation timeline
7. Support and maintenance details
Submissions should be provided in PDF format.
8. Evaluation Criteria
Proposals will be evaluated based on:

‚óè Technical fit (40%)
‚óè Security and compliance (25%)
‚óè Cost (20%)
‚óè Vendor experience (10%)
‚óè Implementation timeline (5%)
9. Timeline
Milestone Date
RFP Issued December 20,
2025
Questions Due December 30,
2025
Proposal Due January 10, 2026
Vendor Selection January 20, 2026
Project Start February 2026
10. Contact Information
All communications regarding this RFP should be directed to:
Procurement Office
Acme Health Services, Inc.
Email: procurement@acmehealth.example
11. Confidentiality
All information provided in response to this RFP will be treated as confidential and used solely
for evaluation purposes.
Why this is a good test artifact

‚óè Multiple structured sections
‚óè Realistic enterprise language
‚óè Clear entities, dates, requirements, and constraints
‚óè Easy to extract: scope, requirements, timelines, contacts
‚óè Perfect for testing:
‚óã Doc ingestion
‚óã Chunking
‚óã Requirement extraction
‚óã Summary generation
‚óã Vendor fit analysis
If you want, next we can:
‚óè Add intentional ambiguity (to test reasoning)
‚óè Create a bad RFP (realistic garbage input)
‚óè Generate 3 fake vendor responses to test comparison
‚óè Turn this into a multi-doc Drive folder test (RFP + addendum + Q&A)
Just say the word.
